intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. calabrum, commonly known as the Calabrian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, often in open habitats such as slopes and grasslands. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphology and habitat preferences compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
